snippet: The military’s study was met with criticism that its findings offer no way of knowing whether attacks had risen.
abstract: Pentagon study shows 50 percent increase in 2013 in reports of rapes and sexual assaults in military; White House and Defense Dept characterize study as welcome sign that victims are more comfortable coming forward, but critics say there is no way to know if increase in reporting meant that there were more sexual assaults over all in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The military’s study was met with criticism that its findings offer no way of knowing whether attacks had risen.

headline.main: Pentagon Study Finds 50% Increase in Reports of Military Sexual Assaults
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Study Finds 50% Increase in Reports of Military Sexual Assaults

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
